Responsibilities:

The Associate Scientist, Immunology, will be responsible for the following job duties:
  • Perform and design experiments using cell based and immunological assays to advance drug discovery research programs;
  • Plan, design, and perform methodologies and execute projects related to T cell cultures and isolation of immune cell types according to plans and protocols with appropriate supervision;
  • Interpret data, draw conclusions, and present results in connection with immunological techniques both within and outside of his or her group;
  • Work independently after training and follow safety rules and regulations;
  • Maintain records of all cell-based and immunological assay experimentation and establish protocols; and
  • Contribute critically to improve techniques or strategies.
Requirements & Qualifications:
  • Master's degree in Pharmaceutical Science, Biotechnology, or a closely related field and one (1) year of work experience in assay design and development within a Pharmaceutical or Biotechnology industry;
  • Demonstrated ability isolating, growing, and developing blood derived white cells, such as T lymphocytes, macrophages, and dendritic cells, gained through one (1) year of lab bench experience;
  • Demonstrated ability performing high throughput ELISA based assays gained through one (1) year of work experience;
  • Demonstrated ability conducting phenotypic analysis of cells using Flow Cytometry gained through one (1) year of lab bench experience;
  • Demonstrated knowledge of Graphpad prism and Spotfire gained through one (1) year of work experience;
  • Demonstrated ability working in a Quality Level 2 laboratory or GLP2 level laboratory gained through one (1) year of work experience;
  • Demonstrated knowledge of automation technology such as Bravo, Via Flow, and iQue Screener gained through one (1) year of work experience; and
  • Demonstrated ability conducting gene expression analysis from primary and culture blood cells gained through one (1) year of work experience.
All years of experience may be gained concurrently.

This position is eligible for the EMD Serono Research & Development Institute, Inc. Employee Referral Program.
